escape_implicit_backslashes.summary: Escape implicit backslashes in strings and heredocs to ease the understanding of which are special chars interpreted by PHP and which not.
escape_implicit_backslashes.description:
In PHP double-quoted strings and heredocs some chars like `n`, `$` or `u` have special meanings if preceded by a backslash (and some are special only if followed by other special chars), while a backslash preceding other chars are interpreted like a plain backslash. The precise list of those special chars is hard to remember and to identify quickly: this fixer escapes backslashes that do not start a special interpretation with the char after them.
It is possible to fix also single-quoted strings: in this case there is no special chars apart from single-quote and backslash itself, so the fixer simply ensure that all backslashes are escaped. Both single and double backslashes are allowed in single-quoted strings, so the purpose in this context is mainly to have a uniformed way to have them written all over the codebase.

explicit_indirect_variable.summary: Add curly braces to indirect variables to make them clear to understand. Requires PHP >= 7.0.

explicit_string_variable.summary: Converts implicit variables into explicit ones in double-quoted strings or heredoc syntax.
explicit_string_variable.description:
The reasoning behind this rule is the following:
- When there are two valid ways of doing the same thing, using both is confusing, there should be a coding standard to follow
- PHP manual marks `"$var"` syntax as implicit and `"${var}"` syntax as explicit: explicit code should always be preferred
- Explicit syntax allows word concatenation inside strings, e.g. `"${var}IsAVar"`, implicit doesn't
- Explicit syntax is easier to detect for IDE/editors and therefore has colors/highlight with higher contrast, which is easier to read
Backtick operator is skipped because it is harder to handle; you can use `backtick_to_shell_exec` fixer to normalize backticks to strings

final_class.summary: All classes must be final, except abstract ones and Doctrine entities.
final_class.description: No exception and no configuration are intentional. Beside Doctrine entities and of course abstract classes, there is no single reason not to declare all classes final. If you want to subclass a class, mark the parent class as abstract and create two child classes, one empty if necessary: you'll gain much more fine grained type-hinting. If you need to mock a standalone class, create an interface, or maybe it's a value-object that shouldn't be mocked at all. If you need to extend a standalone class, create an interface and use the Composite pattern. If you aren't ready yet for serious OOP, go with FinalInternalClassFixer, it's fine.

header_comment.summary: Add, replace or remove header comment.

configuration.name: indentation
configuration.description: Whether the indentation should be the same as in the start token line or one level more.

heredoc_indentation.summary: Heredoc/nowdoc content must be properly indented. Requires PHP >= 7.3.

implode_call.summary: Function `implode` must be called with 2 arguments in the documented order.
implode_call.riskyDescription: Risky when the function `implode` is overridden.

include.summary: Include/Require and file path should be divided with a single space. File path should not be placed under brackets.

configuration.name: style
configuration.description: Whether to use pre- or post-increment and decrement operators.

increment_style.summary: Pre- or post-increment and decrement operators should be used if possible.

indentation_type.summary: Code MUST use configured indentation type.

configuration.name: use_yoda_style
configuration.description: Whether Yoda style conditions should be used.

is_null.riskyDescription: Risky when the function `is_null` is overridden.

lambda_not_used_import.summary: Lambda must not import variables it doesn't use.

line_ending.summary: All PHP files must use same line ending.

linebreak_after_opening_tag.summary: Ensure there is no code on the same line as the PHP open tag.

configuration.name: syntax
configuration.description: Whether to use the `long` or `short` `list` syntax.

list_syntax.summary: List (`array` destructuring) assignment should be declared using the configured syntax. Requires PHP >= 7.1.

logical_operators.summary: Use `&&` and `||` logical operators instead of `and` and `or`.
logical_operators.riskyDescription: Risky, because you must double-check if using and/or with lower precedence was intentional.

lowercase_cast.summary: Cast should be written in lower case.

lowercase_constants.summary: The PHP constants `true`, `false`, and `null` MUST be in lower case.

lowercase_keywords.summary: PHP keywords MUST be in lower case.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
    FOREACH($a AS $B) {
        TRY {
            NEW $C($a, ISSET($B));
            WHILE($B) {
                INCLUDE "test.php";
            }
        } CATCH(\Exception $e) {
            EXIT(1);
        }
    }
codeSamples.to:
<?php
    foreach($a as $B) {
        try {
            new $C($a, isset($B));
            while($B) {
                include "test.php";
            }
        } catch(\Exception $e) {
            exit(1);
        }
    }

lowercase_static_reference.summary: Class static references `self`, `static` and `parent` MUST be in lower case.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Foo extends Bar
{
    public function baz1()
    {
        return STATIC::baz2();
    }

    public function baz2($x)
    {
        return $x instanceof Self;
    }

    public function baz3(PaRent $x)
    {
        return true;
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Foo extends Bar
{
    public function baz1()
    {
        return static::baz2();
    }

    public function baz2($x)
    {
        return $x instanceof self;
    }

    public function baz3(parent $x)
    {
        return true;
    }
}

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Foo extends Bar
{
    public function baz(?self $x) : SELF
    {
        return false;
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Foo extends Bar
{
    public function baz(?self $x) : self
    {
        return false;
    }
}

magic_constant_casing.summary: Magic constants should be referred to using the correct casing.

magic_method_casing.summary: Magic method definitions and calls must be using the correct casing.

mb_str_functions.summary: Replace non multibyte-safe functions with corresponding mb function.
mb_str_functions.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the functions are overridden.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
$a = strlen($a);
$a = strpos($a, $b);
$a = strrpos($a, $b);
$a = substr($a, $b);
$a = strtolower($a);
$a = strtoupper($a);
$a = stripos($a, $b);
$a = strripos($a, $b);
$a = strstr($a, $b);
$a = stristr($a, $b);
$a = strrchr($a, $b);
$a = substr_count($a, $b);
codeSamples.to:
<?php
$a = mb_strlen($a);
$a = mb_strpos($a, $b);
$a = mb_strrpos($a, $b);
$a = mb_substr($a, $b);
$a = mb_strtolower($a);
$a = mb_strtoupper($a);
$a = mb_stripos($a, $b);
$a = mb_strripos($a, $b);
$a = mb_strstr($a, $b);
$a = mb_stristr($a, $b);
$a = mb_strrchr($a, $b);
$a = mb_substr_count($a, $b);

configuration.name: after_heredoc
configuration.description: Whether the whitespace between heredoc end and comma should be removed.

configuration.name: ensure_fully_multiline
configuration.description: ensure every argument of a multiline argument list is on its own line

configuration.name: keep_multiple_spaces_after_comma
configuration.description: Whether keep multiple spaces after comma.

configuration.name: on_multiline
configuration.description: Defines how to handle function arguments lists that contain newlines.

method_argument_space.summary: In method arguments and method call, there MUST NOT be a space before each comma and there MUST be one space after each comma. Argument lists MAY be split across multiple lines, where each subsequent line is indented once. When doing so, the first item in the list MUST be on the next line, and there MUST be only one argument per line.

method_chaining_indentation.summary: Method chaining MUST be properly indented. Method chaining with different levels of indentation is not supported.

method_separation.summary: Methods must be separated with one blank line.

    {
    }

{
    protected function foo()
    {
    }

    protected function bar()
    {
    }
}

modernize_types_casting.summary: Replaces `intval`, `floatval`, `doubleval`, `strval` and `boolval` function calls with according type casting operator.
modernize_types_casting.riskyDescription: Risky if any of the functions `intval`, `floatval`, `doubleval`, `strval` or `boolval` are overridden.

multiline_comment_opening_closing.summary: DocBlocks must start with two asterisks, multiline comments must start with a single asterisk, after the opening slash. Both must end with a single asterisk before the closing slash.

/*

 */

 */

/**

 */

configuration.name: strategy
configuration.description: Forbid multi-line whitespace or move the semicolon to the new line for chained calls.

multiline_whitespace_before_semicolons.summary: Forbid multi-line whitespace before the closing semicolon or move the semicolon to the new line for chained calls.

configuration.name: exclude
configuration.description: List of constants to ignore.

configuration.name: fix_built_in
configuration.description: Whether to fix constants returned by `get_defined_constants`. User constants are not accounted in this list and must be specified in the include one.

configuration.name: include
configuration.description: List of additional constants to fix.

configuration.name: scope
configuration.description: Only fix constant invocations that are made within a namespace or fix all.

configuration.name: strict
configuration.description: Whether leading `\` of constant invocation not meant to have it should be removed.

native_constant_invocation.summary: Add leading `\` before constant invocation of internal constant to speed up resolving. Constant name match is case-sensitive, except for `null`, `false` and `true`.
native_constant_invocation.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the constants are namespaced or overridden.

native_function_casing.summary: Function defined by PHP should be called using the correct casing.

configuration.name: exclude
configuration.description: List of functions to ignore.

configuration.name: include
configuration.description: List of function names or sets to fix. Defined sets are `@internal` (all native functions), `@all` (all global functions) and `@compiler_optimized` (functions that are specially optimized by Zend).

configuration.name: scope
configuration.description: Only fix function calls that are made within a namespace or fix all.

configuration.name: strict
configuration.description: Whether leading `\` of function call not meant to have it should be removed.

native_function_invocation.summary: Add leading `\` before function invocation to speed up resolving.
native_function_invocation.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the functions are overridden.

new_with_braces.summary: All instances created with new keyword must be followed by braces.

configuration.name: sets
configuration.description: List of sets to fix. Defined sets are `@internal` (native functions), `@IMAP` (IMAP functions), `@mbreg` (from `ext-mbstring`) `@all` (all listed sets).

no_alias_functions.summary: Master functions shall be used instead of aliases.
no_alias_functions.riskyDescription: Risky when any of the alias functions are overridden.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
$a = chop($b);
close($b);
$a = doubleval($b);
$a = fputs($b, $c);
$a = get_required_files();
ini_alter($b, $c);
$a = is_double($b);
$a = is_integer($b);
$a = is_long($b);
$a = is_real($b);
$a = is_writeable($b);
$a = join($glue, $pieces);
$a = key_exists($key, $array);
magic_quotes_runtime($new_setting);
$a = pos($array);
$a = show_source($filename, true);
$a = sizeof($b);
$a = strchr($haystack, $needle);
$a = imap_header($imap_stream, 1);
user_error($message);
mbereg_search_getregs();
codeSamples.to:
<?php
$a = rtrim($b);
closedir($b);
$a = floatval($b);
$a = fwrite($b, $c);
$a = get_included_files();
ini_set($b, $c);
$a = is_float($b);
$a = is_int($b);
$a = is_int($b);
$a = is_float($b);
$a = is_writable($b);
$a = implode($glue, $pieces);
$a = array_key_exists($key, $array);
set_magic_quotes_runtime($new_setting);
$a = current($array);
$a = highlight_file($filename, true);
$a = count($b);
$a = strstr($haystack, $needle);
$a = imap_headerinfo($imap_stream, 1);
trigger_error($message);
mbereg_search_getregs();

no_binary_string.summary: There should not be a binary flag before strings.

configuration.name: comment_text
configuration.description: The text to use in the added comment and to detect it.

no_break_comment.summary: There must be a comment when fall-through is intentional in a non-empty case body.
no_break_comment.description: Adds a "no break" comment before fall-through cases, and removes it if there is no fall-through.

        baz();
}

    case 1:
        foo();
        // no break
    case 2:
        bar();
        break;
    case 3:
        baz();
}

<?php
switch ($foo) {
    case 1:
        foo();
        // some comment
    case 2:
        foo();
}

no_empty_comment.summary: There should not be any empty comments.

no_empty_phpdoc.summary: There should not be empty PHPDoc blocks.

no_homoglyph_names.summary: Replace accidental usage of homoglyphs (non ascii characters) in names.
no_homoglyph_names.riskyDescription: Renames classes and cannot rename the files. You might have string references to renamed code (`$$name`).

no_leading_namespace_whitespace.summary: The namespace declaration line shouldn't contain leading whitespace.

configuration.name: use
configuration.description: The desired language construct.

no_mixed_echo_print.summary: Either language construct `print` or `echo` should be used.

no_multiline_whitespace_around_double_ar.summary: Operator `=>` should not be surrounded by multi-line whitespaces.

no_multiline_whitespace_before_semicolon.summary: Multi-line whitespace before closing semicolon are prohibited.

no_null_property_initialization.summary: Properties MUST not be explicitly initialized with `null` except when they have a type declaration (PHP 7.4).

no_php4_constructor.riskyDescription: Risky when old style constructor being fixed is overridden or overrides parent one.

no_short_bool_cast.summary: Short cast `bool` using double exclamation mark should not be used.

no_short_echo_tag.summary: Replaces short-echo `<?=` with long format `<?php echo` syntax.

no_singleline_whitespace_before_semicolo.summary: Single-line whitespace before closing semicolon are prohibited.

no_spaces_after_function_name.summary: When making a method or function call, there MUST NOT be a space between the method or function name and the opening parenthesis.

configuration.name: positions
configuration.description: Whether spacing should be fixed inside and/or outside the offset braces.

no_spaces_around_offset.summary: There MUST NOT be spaces around offset braces.

no_spaces_inside_parenthesis.summary: There MUST NOT be a space after the opening parenthesis. There MUST NOT be a space before the closing parenthesis.

configuration.name: allow_mixed
configuration.description: Whether type `mixed` without description is allowed (`true`) or considered superfluous (`false`)

configuration.name: allow_unused_params
configuration.description: Whether `param` annotation without actual signature is allowed (`true`) or considered superfluous (`false`)

configuration.name: remove_inheritdoc
configuration.description: Remove `@inheritDoc` tags

no_superfluous_phpdoc_tags.summary: Removes `@param`, `@return` and `@var` tags that don't provide any useful information.

no_trailing_comma_in_list_call.summary: Remove trailing commas in list function calls.

no_trailing_comma_in_singleline_array.summary: PHP single-line arrays should not have trailing comma.

no_trailing_whitespace.summary: Remove trailing whitespace at the end of non-blank lines.

no_trailing_whitespace_in_comment.summary: There MUST be no trailing spaces inside comment or PHPDoc.

no_trailing_whitespace_in_string.summary: There must be no trailing whitespace in strings.
no_trailing_whitespace_in_string.riskyDescription: Changing the whitespaces in strings might affect string comparisons and outputs.

configuration.name: statements

no_unneeded_control_parentheses.summary: Removes unneeded parentheses around control statements.

configuration.name: namespaces
configuration.description: Remove unneeded curly braces from bracketed namespaces.

no_unneeded_curly_braces.summary: Removes unneeded curly braces that are superfluous and aren't part of a control structure's body.

configuration.name: private_methods
configuration.description: Private methods of non-`final` classes must not be declared `final`.

no_unneeded_final_method.summary: A `final` class must not have `final` methods and `private` methods must not be `final`.
no_unneeded_final_method.riskyDescription: Risky when child class overrides a `private` method.

no_unreachable_default_argument_value.summary: In function arguments there must not be arguments with default values before non-default ones.
no_unreachable_default_argument_value.riskyDescription: Modifies the signature of functions; therefore risky when using systems (such as some Symfony components) that rely on those (for example through reflection).

no_unset_cast.summary: Variables must be set `null` instead of using `(unset)` casting.

no_unset_on_property.summary: Properties should be set to `null` instead of using `unset`.
no_unset_on_property.riskyDescription: Risky when relying on attributes to be removed using `unset` rather than be set to `null`. Changing variables to `null` instead of unsetting means these still show up when looping over class variables and reference properties remain unbroken. With PHP 7.4, this rule might introduce `null` assignments to properties whose type declaration does not allow it.

no_useless_else.summary: There should not be useless `else` cases.

no_useless_return.summary: There should not be an empty `return` statement at the end of a function.

no_useless_sprintf.summary: There must be no `sprintf` calls with only the first argument.
no_useless_sprintf.riskyDescription: Risky when if the `sprintf` function is overridden.

configuration.name: after_heredoc
configuration.description: Whether the whitespace between heredoc end and comma should be removed.

no_whitespace_before_comma_in_array.summary: In array declaration, there MUST NOT be a whitespace before each comma.

no_whitespace_in_blank_line.summary: Remove trailing whitespace at the end of blank lines.

configuration.name: use_escape_sequences_in_strings
configuration.description: Whether characters should be replaced with escape sequences in strings.

non_printable_character.summary: Remove Zero-width space (ZWSP), Non-breaking space (NBSP) and other invisible unicode symbols.
non_printable_character.riskyDescription: Risky when strings contain intended invisible characters.

normalize_index_brace.summary: Array index should always be written by using square braces.

not_operator_with_space.summary: Logical NOT operators (`!`) should have leading and trailing whitespaces.

not_operator_with_successor_space.summary: Logical NOT operators (`!`) should have one trailing whitespace.

configuration.name: use_nullable_type_declaration
configuration.description: Whether to add or remove `?` before type declarations for parameters with a default `null` value.

nullable_type_declaration_for_default_nu.summary: Adds or removes `?` before type declarations for parameters with a default `null` value.
nullable_type_declaration_for_default_nu.description: Rule is applied only in a PHP 7.1+ environment.

object_operator_without_whitespace.summary: There should not be space before or after object `T_OBJECT_OPERATOR` `->`.

configuration.name: only_booleans
configuration.description: whether to limit operators to only boolean ones

configuration.name: position
configuration.description: whether to place operators at the beginning or at the end of the line

operator_linebreak.summary: Operators - when multiline - must always be at the beginning or at the end of the line.

configuration.name: order
configuration.description: List of strings defining order of elements.

configuration.name: sort_algorithm
configuration.description: How multiple occurrences of same type statements should be sorted

final class Example
{

    const C1 = 1;

psr0.summary: Classes must be in a path that matches their namespace, be at least one namespace deep and the class name should match the file name.

configuration.name: dir

psr_autoloading.summary: Classes must be in a path that matches their namespace, be at least one namespace deep and the class name should match the file name.

configuration.name: replacements
configuration.description: Mapping between replaced functions with the new ones.

random_api_migration.summary: Replaces `rand`, `srand`, `getrandmax` functions calls with their `mt_*` analogs.
random_api_migration.riskyDescription: Risky when the configured functions are overridden.

regular_callable_call.summary: Callables must be called without using `call_user_func*` when possible.
regular_callable_call.riskyDescription: Risky when the `call_user_func` or `call_user_func_array` function is overridden or when are used in constructions that should be avoided, like `call_user_func_array('foo', ['bar' => 'baz'])` or `call_user_func($foo, $foo = 'bar')`.

return_assignment.summary: Local, dynamic and directly referenced variables should not be assigned and directly returned by a function or method.

configuration.name: space_before
configuration.description: Spacing to apply before colon.

return_type_declaration.summary: There should be one or no space before colon, and one space after it in return type declarations, according to configuration.
return_type_declaration.description: Rule is applied only in a PHP 7+ environment.

self_accessor.summary: Inside class or interface element `self` should be preferred to the class name itself.
self_accessor.riskyDescription: Risky when using dynamic calls like get_called_class() or late static binding.

    }

    }
}

strict_comparison.riskyDescription: Changing comparisons to strict might change code behavior.

strict_param.summary: Functions should be used with `$strict` param set to `true`.

strict_param.riskyDescription: Risky when the fixed function is overridden or if the code relies on non-strict usage.

string_line_ending.summary: All multi-line strings must use correct line ending.
string_line_ending.riskyDescription: Changing the line endings of multi-line strings might affect string comparisons and outputs.

switch_case_semicolon_to_colon.summary: A case should be followed by a colon and not a semicolon.

switch_case_space.summary: Removes extra spaces between colon and case value.

switch_continue_to_break.summary: Switch case must not be ended with `continue` but with `break`.

codeSamples.from:

switch ($foo) {
    case 1:
        while($bar) {
            do {
                continue 3;
            } while(false);

            if ($foo + 1 > 3) {
                continue;
            }

            continue 2;
        }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
switch ($foo) {
    case 1:
        while($bar) {
            do {
                break 3;
            } while(false);

            if ($foo + 1 > 3) {
                continue;
            }

            break 2;
        }
}

ternary_to_elvis_operator.summary: Use the Elvis operator `?:` where possible.
ternary_to_elvis_operator.riskyDescription: Risky when relying on functions called on both sides of the `?` operator.

codeSamples.from: <?php $foo = $bar[a()] ? $bar[a()] : 1; # "risky" sample, "a()" only gets called once after fixing
codeSamples.to: <?php $foo = $bar[a()] ?  : 1; # "risky" sample, "a()" only gets called once after fixing

ternary_to_null_coalescing.summary: Use `null` coalescing operator `??` where possible. Requires PHP >= 7.0.

configuration.name: after_heredoc
configuration.description: Whether a trailing comma should also be placed after heredoc end.

trailing_comma_in_multiline_array.summary: PHP multi-line arrays should have a trailing comma.

trim_array_spaces.summary: Arrays should be formatted like function/method arguments, without leading or trailing single line space.

unary_operator_spaces.summary: Unary operators should be placed adjacent to their operands.

use_arrow_functions.summary: Anonymous functions with one-liner return statement must use arrow functions.
use_arrow_functions.riskyDescription: Risky when using `isset()` on outside variables that are not imported with `use ()`.

configuration.name: elements
configuration.description: The structural elements to fix (PHP >= 7.1 required for `const`).

visibility_required.summary: Visibility MUST be declared on all properties and methods; `abstract` and `final` MUST be declared before the visibility; `static` MUST be declared after the visibility.

codeSamples.from:
<?php
class Sample
{
    var $a;
    static protected $var_foo2;

    function A()
    {
    }
}
codeSamples.to:
<?php
class Sample
{
    public $a;
    protected static $var_foo2;

    public function A()
    {
    }
}

void_return.summary: Add `void` return type to functions with missing or empty return statements, but priority is given to `@return` annotations. Requires PHP >= 7.1.

whitespace_after_comma_in_array.summary: In array declaration, there MUST be a whitespace after each comma.

configuration.name: always_move_variable
configuration.description: Whether variables should always be on non assignable side when applying Yoda style.

configuration.name: equal
configuration.description: Style for equal (`==`, `!=`) statements.

configuration.name: identical
configuration.description: Style for identical (`===`, `!==`) statements.

configuration.name: less_and_greater
configuration.description: Style for less and greater than (`<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`) statements.

yoda_style.summary: Write conditions in Yoda style (`true`), non-Yoda style (`['equal' => false, 'identical' => false, 'less_and_greater' => false]`) or ignore those conditions (`null`) based on configuration.

codeSamples.to:
<?php
    // Enforce non-Yoda style.
    if ($a === null) {
        echo "null";
    }
